text: We are doing blend modes (multiply) on assets in the Meijer Mac app - Phillip and I were just discussing asset prep for the companion website and while we cant use it for this project...   blend modes are on their way to CSS...    <http://dev.w3.org/fxtf/compositing-1/>
as of iOS 8 and  Yosemite  - Safari supports them and both Chrome and Firefox added support for them over the summer.
No big surprise though on IE - no support at all.  :sad-trombone
<@U0289USNA> I did some research on the blend modes and their support is very limited.
Still very tricky to implement.
That's for web/css, of course.
<@U0289USNA> background-blend-mode won't work I suppose since you're putting two assets on top of each other?
...and also no IE support
right - I told Phillip that we cant do it for Meijer web...  But it's nice to know that someday we will be able to...

<@U02618EV1> support is improving   Just released browsers this month that have added support for it include Safari Mac, Safari iOS (8), Chrome for Android, and Android Browser (Lollipop).   Firefox and Chrome were already supporting as of July and Opera added support last month.
Yes, I saw that.
Also, will most likely need a 'designed' fallback given how blend modes are typically used in design.
<!channel> Anyone knows of good resources to learn more about the math behind animating objects in geometric shapes?

Something like this post, for example, but for other shapes too: 
<http://krazydad.com/tutorials/circles_js/>
<@U02618EV1>: what specifically are you trying to do?
I have a source, but it's a person - not a website :simple_smile:
<@U02HCCTFL> It's purely for educational purposes. Trying to learn more about how to coding graphics.
<@U02618EV1> it may not teach much programming, but you can learn about shape construction through <http://euclidthegame.com/>
<@U026PT0D7> OHHHH. Thanks man!
careful. it's addicting
cool!
